decision_conditions:
Alternative Specification:

The tree may be pruned back to its established historical pruning points only. No reduction beyond these points is permitted.
Reasoning:

Tree Health and Structure: Reducing beyond the historical pruning points can result in large wounds that the tree may struggle to compartmentalise. This increases the risk of decay and structural weakness, which could ultimately lead to the treeâ€™s decline or failure.

Amenity Value: The tree is protected under a Tree Preservation Order (TPO) due to its significant contribution to local amenity. Excessive reduction would compromise its visual appeal and ecological function, diminishing the value it provides to the surrounding area.
description:
T1 Eucalyptus - Reduce the height by approximatelty 8 matres to appoximately 1 metre below the historical pruning points.  Dimensions after pruming  H 18m  W 10m

To Improve light into all properties, reduce debris and prevent damage to hard standings and boundary fences.
